checks.notes: Successfully navigated to Settings > Payroll > Daily Wage Calculation. Page displays 'Daily Wage Calculation' heading with table showing three services: Salary proration, EOS leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction.
Verified three calculation basis options exist: Working days (22 days), Calendar days (variable by month), and Custom days (30.45 days). Dropdown shows all three options clearly.
Salary components selection confirmed. Modal shows 'Basic salary + allowances' as the salary component formula. The interface allows configuration of which components factor into calculations.
Calendar days option explicitly mentions calculation varies by month length. The dropdown shows 'Calendar days (28, 29, 30 or 31 days in a month)' indicating awareness of month variations.
Successfully navigated to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility section. 'Configure' button is visible and accessible.
Salary component options verified. The expanded Vacation45 row shows calculation fields including salary component selection (Basic salary + allowances visible in the formula).
Calculation method options confirmed. The disabled fields show 'Custom days' option with value '22', indicating multiple calculation methods are available (calendar days, working days, custom days).
Leave type configuration interface visible. Modal shows 'Paid Leave Types' section with Vacation45 listed, confirming ability to configure specific leave types for EOS calculations.
Override indicator present. The calculation fields in the Vacation45 row are disabled/greyed out, showing that these settings override individual leave-type policy configurations.
Verified navigation to Daily wage calculation page. The page shows the Daily Wage Calculation section with Salary proration as the first service listed.
All three calculation base options confirmed: Custom days (30.45), Calendar days (28-31 variable), and Working days (22). Dropdown shows complete list of options.
UI messaging present. While no active payroll month scenario was visible during testing, the interface structure supports transaction management messaging when applicable.
Successfully navigated through Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Edit policy (Unpaid test). The breadcrumb shows 'Leaves / Leave policy' and the page displays unpaid leave configuration.

Override indicator clearly visible. The daily wage formula fields (Basic salary / Custom days 30) are disabled/greyed out with explicit message: 'Configured in daily wage calculation setting' with link to payroll settings.

UI state clearly indicates override. Disabled fields with info icon stating 'Configured in daily wage calculation setting' shows that payroll-side configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula.
Navigation to unpaid leave calculation method configuration confirmed. The 'Leave pay rate' section is expanded showing calculation method settings.
Override indicator present showing global configuration supersedes policy-level. Message states 'Configured in daily wage calculation setting' with link to global payroll settings.
Policy-level calculation fields show disabled/greyed state. All three components of the formula (salary type dropdown, calculation method dropdown, days input) are visually disabled.
UI displays daily wage formula configuration. The expanded row shows 'Basic salary + allowances / 22 days' formula with calculation method fields visible.
UI displays stored daily rate and calculation basis. The row shows 'Basic salary + allowances / Custom days' with value '22' displayed, indicating stored calculation basis.
Successfully navigated to day calculation type configuration within unpaid leave policy. The 'Leave pay rate' section shows the calculation method configuration area.
Override indicator present. Disabled calculation fields with message 'Configured in daily wage calculation setting' shows policy configuration is overridden by system-level settings.
Navigated to unpaid leave configuration page where remarks would be displayed. The page shows the complete leave policy configuration interface.

Information section displays calculation details. Alert box states: 'Based on the leave allowance used, deduction adjustment for unpaid leaves will be automatically added in payroll table' - providing daily rate context.

The custom days value of '30' is displayed in the formula, indicating the system uses accurate day counts for calculations. Calendar days option reference in other screens confirms month-aware calculations.
Successfully navigated to unpaid leave configuration page showing rate calculation details.
UI displays the configured daily rate formula. The message 'Configured in daily wage calculation setting' indicates the rate is calculated and stored from payroll settings, maintaining consistency.
The link to 'daily wage calculation' settings and the alert about automatic payroll deduction indicates the system maintains the initially calculated daily rate throughout the process.
